description: Saver's Switch is a direct load control program that allows Xcel Energy (Northern States Power Company) to remotely cycle residential and commercial air conditioning units and electric water heaters during high demand periods. The program uses small remote-controlled switches installed adjacent to customer equipment. Current operation involves cycling equipment off for 15 minutes, then on for 15 minutes during peak demand days. The program is designed to reduce peak demand by up to 60% during load management periods, with the utility reserving the right to cycle equipment on a schedule to achieve up to 80% reduction for additional load relief. The program has operated for several decades in South Dakota. In April 2024, the South Dakota Public Utilities Commission denied Xcel's request to extend cycling parameters to 18 minutes off/12 minutes on for up to 300 hours per year.

service_territories: Xcel Energy South Dakota service territory

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Program targets residential and commercial customers with central air conditioning units and electric water heaters. Not applicable to commercial battery energy storage systems. Program does not accept window units, wall units, rooftop AC units, or ductless mini splits. Not recommended for hospitals, restaurants, nursing homes, or facilities with heat-generating equipment. TX & NM tariffs (in other service territories) require enrolled commercial AC units to be at least 5 tons in size.

seasonal_rates.notes: Payment only during June through September for air conditioning control

capacity_rate.notes: Business customers receive $5 per ton of enrolled air conditioning per month from June through September. Payment structure verified for Minnesota and Wisconsin service territories; assumed same for South Dakota based on common program name and tariff structure, but exact South Dakota rate not independently confirmed.

seasons.notes: AC cycling events normally occur on high demand days during summer months
Water heater interruptions can occur on high demand days during winter months

event_parameters.notes: Current cycling pattern: 15 minutes off, 15 minutes on, repeated during events. Events have historically occurred once per year during the past five years (2019-2024) and lasted 2-4 hours. Xcel proposed changing to 18 minutes off/12 minutes on for up to 300 hours per year, but this was denied by the PUC in April 2024. Equipment is cycled to achieve up to 60% reduction during load management periods, with the utility reserving the right to achieve 80% reduction for additional load relief.

enrollment_period.notes: Open enrollment program. Installation requires licensed electrician to install remote-controlled switch. Free switch and installation provided by Xcel Energy.

program_evolution.change_description: October 2023: Northern States Power Company filed application (Docket EL23-032) to modify Controlled Air Conditioning and Water Heater Rider tariff to extend cycling to 18 minutes off/12 minutes on for up to 300 hours per year.
April 2024: South Dakota Public Utilities Commission unanimously denied the proposed tariff modifications, maintaining current 15 minutes off/15 minutes on cycling parameters.

program_history.notes: Program has operated for several decades in South Dakota according to regulatory filings. Program serves more than 22,000 residential and commercial customers in South Dakota.

integration_metadata.battery_suitability_explanation: This program is NOT APPLICABLE to commercial battery energy storage systems. Saver's Switch is exclusively a direct load control program for residential and commercial HVAC equipment (central air conditioning) and electric water heaters. The program involves physical installation of remote-controlled switches on air conditioning compressors and water heaters to cycle them on/off during peak demand periods. Battery energy storage systems are not eligible equipment types for this program. Xcel Energy operates separate battery storage programs (such as Battery Connect and distributed capacity procurement initiatives) that would be more appropriate for commercial BESS participation.
integration_metadata.annual_revenue_calculation: Not applicable - program does not accept battery energy storage systems as eligible resources. Only air conditioning units (payment of $5/ton/month for June-September = $20/ton/year) and electric water heaters are eligible.

The program is well-documented as an AC/water heater direct load control program, but detailed operational data and SD-specific rates could not be independently confirmed. This program should be classified as N/A for battery suitability rather than POOR because it fundamentally serves a different purpose (HVAC load control) and is not designed or intended for battery storage applications.
